intro: Echinopsis haematantha var. hualfinensis, commonly known as the Hualfín moon cactus, is a cactus species native to the Andes mountains of Argentina. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and a dense covering of white to pale blue spines. The plant produces large, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming at night. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated by enthusiasts of succulent and cactus plants.
